actions.committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Public Works + Transportation.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Grounds.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Subcommittee Hearings Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Reported by the Committee on Public Works + Transportation. H. Rept. 103-456.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 146.
Mr. Traficant moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 5, rule I, the chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
Considered as unfinished business.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 408 - 0 (Roll no. 97).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 410.
Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.
Cleared for White House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 103-241.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Grounds

official_title: To designate the United States courthouse under construction in Denver, Colorado, as the "Byron White United States Courthouse".

summary.text: Designates the United States courthouse being constructed through renovation of the old post office building in Denver, Colorado, as the Byron White United States Courthouse.

titles.title: To designate the United States courthouse under construction in Denver, Colorado, as the "Byron White United States Courthouse".
